settings.shipping_text: your 1st order ships free, use code: bienvenue. free shipping for orders above
settings.share: share your moment on @scandale.ecolingerie to be featured & earn a chance to win your €70 voucher.
settings.description1: from yarn wastes - PRC, Taiwan & Thailand

settings.title:
free shipping for your 1st order
use code: bienvenue

settings.question: what countries do you ship to?
settings.answer: we currently ship to France, Germany, Spain & Italy. we are working on shipping to more countries, contact us for more information

settings.question: what shipping methods do you offer?
settings.answer: we only offer standard shipping to limit our impact on the planet

settings.question: how fast is your shipping?
settings.answer:
- most of our orders are shipped within 1-2 business days of purchase. business days are Monday to Friday (excluding public holidays).

- you will receive an email when the order is shipped. once your order is shipped, we estimate you will receive your order within 2-6 business days. COVID-19 update: currently, our warehouse in Belgium is operating at full capacity. however, shipping times may vary.

- our shipping carriers do not deliver on weekends or public holidays.

- note: we cannot deliver to BFPO or PO addresses. we apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.


destination shipping method delivery time
(working days)
France Colissimo 2-3
Germany DHL 2-3
Spain Celeritas 3-4
Italy SDA 3-4

settings.question: how much does shipping cost?
settings.answer: please refer to the shipping cost table to find the shipping details for your country. orders over €69 qualify for free shipping.

settings.question: how can I track my order?
settings.answer: you will receive an email with the tracking information of your parcel. you can also track your order by logging into your account.

settings.question: what items are eligible for return?
settings.answer:
- all products that are unworn, unwashed, in their original condition with all tags attached & inside their original compostable bag can be returned within 30 days after you have received your package. we reserve the right to refuse returns that show signs of wear or do not meet the above criteria.

- we ask you to wear underwear when trying on our products for hygiene reasons. panties with the hygienic sticker removed cannot be returned.

- final sale items cannot be returned.

- returns cannot be combined with multiple orders.

settings.question: how do I return an order?
settings.answer:
- complete the return request on our return portal & you will receive a pre-paid (by scandale) return shipping label.

- you would have to cover the cost of the return shipping, which will be then automatically deducted from the refunded amount. please see below for more information on the return shipping cost.

- we encourage you to reuse the original mailer for your return!

settings.question: how long does it take to process my return?
settings.answer:
- once your return is received, we will notify you if your return is accepted. the process can take up to 5 working days.

- refund amount will be credited to your original payment method within 3-7 working days after we have processed the return.

settings.question: how can I receive my refund?
settings.answer: your refund will be credited back to the original form of payment

settings.question: is the original shipping cost refundable on return orders?
settings.answer: no, the original shipping cost will not be refunded.

settings.question: how do I exchange an order?
settings.answer: - currently, we do not offer exchanges. you would have to make a return, ask for a refund & then make a new order

settings.question: How can I make an exchange?
settings.answer: currently, we do not offer exchanges. you would have to make a return, ask for a refund & then make a new order.

settings.question: do I need an account to make a purchase?
settings.answer: you do not need an account to make a purchase

settings.question: how do I reset my password for my account?
settings.answer: you can request to reset your password by following the instructions for ‘forgotten password’ on the ‘sign in’ page.

settings.question: what payment methods do you accept? / How can I pay for my order?
settings.answer: we currently accept the following payment methods:  Visa, MasterCard, American Express, Maestro, Shop Pay, Apple Pay and Google Pay.

settings.question: do I need to pay for duties and taxes?
settings.answer: tax and duties are calculated according to your shipping destination. they are estimated and included as part of the final payment at time of checkout.

settings.question: how do I use a promotional code?
settings.answer: you can enter your promotional code before you checkout

settings.question: how do you choose your materials?
settings.answer: we prioritize using materials coming from a previous life & their éco-impact. we will increase our locally-sourced materials to recycle & increase the use of previous life materials for future collections to 90% by 2023.

settings.question: what is carbon neutral?
settings.answer:
1st - we use life-cycle assessment in our every process to minimise our carbon emissions

2nd - we 'offset' our carbon emission upstream & downstream through certified climate projects to achieve neutrality on our entire value chain

settings.question: can’t find what you need on our FAQ page? we are here to help
settings.answer: leave us a message & we will get back to you within 1 business day.

settings.subheading: sign up to save on your 1st order.

settings.title: our product bags
settings.description: are certified home compostable, using plant-based materials (corn starch)

settings.title: our product tags

settings.title: our mailers
settings.description: are made with recycled paper in its natural colour, specially designed to be reused for returns or please recycle them

settings.title: 1st éco-lingerie with a 'French-touch' with people & planet in mind
settings.description: committed to ré-inventing fashion lingerie with people & planet in mind, focusing on circularity & decarbonisation

created the 1st underwear with lycra®
collaboration with Mr René Gruau French iconic illustrator, who co-designed scandale colour & logo

settings.title: collaboration with Mr. Christian Dior
settings.description:
with the inventor of the 'New Look' & projects with Jean Patou maison de couture, scandale continued to push boundaries with lightweight
tiles & elastics.

settings.title: 1st elastic & lightweight girdle
settings.description: invented in Lyon, turned latex liquid into latex yarn, liberated women from french corsetry & conventions. scandale has been seen as a pioneer of modern disruptive communication.

settings.title: previous life materials
settings.description: focusing yarns from previous life, we design éco-lingerie with circularity in mind

settings.title: planet in mind
settings.description: 100% éco-fabrics & carbon neutral from start, we put sustainability at the core of our business

settings.title: people in mind
settings.description: we are committed to care, educate & empowering our workers communities

settings.title: know your éco-lingerie
settings.description: we owe you transparency about our manufacturers, their locations, their teams and their commitments.

settings.title: sustainability report 2021
settings.description: we measure our progress to define the next steps of our éco-journey, being conscious of the challenges ahead of us.

settings.title: still much to do
settings.description: we are on a journey of challenging ourselves to be even more sustainable & do more for our communities

settings.title: a Pending B Corporation
settings.description:
B Corporation is a movement to redefine success in business and build a more inclusive and sustainable economy, certifying businesses that meet the highest standards of vitrified social & environmental standards.

As a big believer of this vision, we are happy & honoured to be official part of the movement.
global greenhouse gas emission comes from fashion industry

lingerie brands have
sustainability at their core

settings.title: éco-conscious design
settings.desc: we focus on materials coming from previous life. only 8 éco-fabrics & 14 signature shapes to minimise our environmental impact.

settings.title: upcycling fabric waste
settings.desc: we are partnering with Anew Studios to collect fabric from our cutting tables, upcycling them for a 2nd life.

settings.title: locally sourced
settings.desc: increase locally sourced recycled materials & create a tighter regional recycling network.

settings.title: closing the loop
settings.desc: finding solutions to give another life to your scandale éco-lingerie. for now, wash & donate to your beloved charity.

settings.title: 90% previous life materials
settings.desc: increasing the use of previous life materials for future collections from 80% to 90% by 2023.

settings.title: what if it is not sustainable?
settings.short_description: We work with XXX to collect all the fabric waste from the cutting table, recycling them into XXX & XXX.

settings.title: recycled nylon
settings.sub_title: from yarn wastes - PRC, Taiwan & Thailand

settings.title: <0.5kg CO2eq upstream by 2024
settings.desc: our goal is to reduce our CO2eq per unit by -40% (cradle to gate) & work together to reduce product use carbon footprint

settings.title: 25% renewable energy by 2024
settings.desc: work with our manufacturing partners to favour significantly higher adoption rate of renewable energy

settings.title: alternative dyes
settings.desc: chemical dyes are a big challenge for us - we don't like them but they bring colour vibrancy & longevity to products. we continue investigating for more sustainable alternatives

settings.title: measure before you buy
settings.desc: we recommend you to use our bra size calculator to find your right size & guarantee the best fit. it would avoid unnecessary returns & its planet impacts.

settings.title: wash sustainably
settings.desc:
we recommend hand wash. when machine wash, please use a short washing cycle at 30 degree

avoid the dryer as it consumes high energy & not the best friend of your lingerie

always wash with planet-friendly biological soap flakes like 'Fer à Cheval' soap from Marseille, made with plant-based oils no preservatives, dyes, additives or animal fat

settings.title: stop microfibres
settings.desc: many microfibres can be released from a single load of laundry, polluting water bodies & entering the food chain. we recommend to always use a GUPPYFRIEND washing bag to stop microfibers pollution. available for 29.75€ at check-out.

settings.title: mix & play
settings.short_description: designed to bring endless possibilities of 2000+ combinations for continuous excitement - buying less, making them last & reducing waste

settings.title: the most sustainable colour
settings.short_description: we began our design with 'undyed' fabrics. amazed by the result, we decided to make it part of our permanent collection.

settings.title: a permanent collection
settings.desc: 105 styles based only on 14 signature shapes to maximize resources efficiency. we defy fast fashion rhythm & impact

settings.title: responsible & undyed packaging
settings.desc: from plant-based home compostable product bags to recycled & recyclable paper mailer. we avoid using mono-use plastic in our packaging

settings.title: low-impact logistics
settings.desc: working with sustainable logistic partners, with our main warehouse powered by renewable energy

settings.title: certifications driven
settings.desc: creating the collection with certified éco-fabrics, including Standard 100 by OEKO-TEX®

settings.title: sea not air
settings.desc: we use low-emission sea freight whenever possible for all materials & finished garments

settings.title: sustainable at our core
settings.short_description: our concentrated network of suppliers allows us to go direct to the source & minimise éco-impact from transportation

settings.title: on our way to net zero
settings.short_desc: we are adapting science-based target - a clear, scientific, data-driven pathway for companies to reduce their greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions for a better future

settings.title: 2025 climate positive
settings.sub_title: climate positive in our entire value chain by 2025
settings.short_desc: we are working with our partners to further reduce our GHG emissions & reach a positive impact to our environment. we are working on a precise roadmap & will share our progress in our sustainability updates

settings.title: we offset all our CO2
settings.sub_title: our project is Clean Wind Energy in Guyuan, PRC
settings.short_desc:
offsetting all our emission from our entire value chain, estimated 1.14kg CO2eq per product.
it creates renewable energy, increases responsible development & contributes to 6 UN sustainable development goals.

settings.title: today…
settings.short_desc:
1st - we use life-cycle assessment in our every process to minimise our carbon emissions

2nd - we 'offset' our carbon emission upstream & downstream through certified climate projects to achieve neutrality on our entire value chain

our goal is to keep the rise in mean global temperature according to the Paris Agreement, COP21 validated by the UN

settings.title: we only work with certified garment manufacturers that care for their people
settings.subtitle: how we select our factories
settings.desc:
we only work with partners who care, educate & empower the people making your lingerie

we developed our own methodology to screen all potential suppliers - on transparency, social & environmental responsibilities.
only suppliers in the top tiers have been selected
settings.btn_label: visit our factories for supply chain traceability

settings.title: we care for our worker's communities
settings.desc:
thus, we are a member of BSR®, an global organization of sustainable businesses that works together to build a just and sustainable world
through HERproject™, we plan to invest into workplace-based programs to enhance knowledge & confidence. we empower our female worker community to promote health, financial inclusion & gender equality

settings.title: a time commitment to our community
settings.desc: we commit to volunteer for 300+ hours to serve our local community. we believe in helping whenever we can, doing every bits to help in any way possible

settings.title: our people project
settings.subtitle: a collaboration with XXX
settings.desc:
We only work with partners that shares the same values as us, hence we developed a system to score all our supplies & their suppliers, what we called a PPR analysis. Only manufacturers with a score above X is considered.

All our direct partners are required to adhere to our Code of Conduct and additional policies. We also require our suppliers to be audited by independent 3rd party to ensure a fair, safe & healthy working conditions throughout our supply chain.

settings.title: interacting with our female workers
settings.desc: post-covid to reconnecting live with our factory workers & re-engage on future projects

settings.title: HERproject™ activation 2022
settings.desc: our 1st women empowerment program through raising awareness & knowledge on critical health & well-being topics

settings.title: reach 100% tier-3 traceability by 2023
settings.desc: continue our traceability due diligence on tier-3 suppliers.

settings.title: expand our scientific measurements
settings.desc: on our materials depending on available technologies.

settings.title: continue raising the bar
settings.desc: obtain higher certifications in social & environmental.

settings.title: how we met?
settings.content:
we contacted Anne.
Anne was passionate about our vision convinced their top management even though we were a new start-up. with an aligned vision of the future, we began our first step of our collaboration.

great commitment from Anne & her team.

settings.title: a more éco future
settings.content: Yisoor measures their use of electricity, water & waste with KPIs & roadmap to reduce their impact and their carbon footprint.

settings.title: certifications
settings.content:
BSCI, Standard 100 by OEKO-TEX®, Higg Index Facility Environmental Module
factory detail information

settings.desc:
at scandale éco-lingerie, we work with partners who care, educate & empower the people making your lingerie.

all our suppliers are adhere to the scandale code of conduct. They are regularly reviewed on their social & environmental responsibilities, and transparency.

settings.title: certified ethical production
settings.desc_first:
we only work with partners who care, educate & empower the people making your lingerie.

we developed our own methodology to screen all potential suppliers - on transparency, social & environmental responsibilities.
only suppliers in the top tiers have been selected.
settings.desc: besides our methodology, suppliers are audited by independent 3rd parties (Sedex & BSCI) to ensure a fair, safe & healthy working conditions. we are participating in the Transparency Pledge & our tier-1 suppliers are registered on 'Open Apparel Registry' to expand the information that are made public.

settings.title_qr: it is your right to know what you are wearing
settings.sub_qr: every scandale éco-lingerie comes with a QR code on its hangtag & care label
settings.desc:
scan to learn about everything we know about your lingerie:
its éco-impact, factory & workers who assembled and sewed it, its éco-journey, our washing & drying recommendations & how to make it last
settings.map_title: we build our supply chain around traceability
settings.desc_map:
we are dedicated to know where our things come from, so we can stand by our values towards the people & planet

in fashion, supply chains are often fragmented & complex. we still have a lot to do to better track & evaluate the lower tiers of our supply chain. we now know 100% of our tier 1 & tier 2 suppliers and we are working to know more about our tier 3 suppliers

settings.description: we use life-cycle assessment to understand our environmental footprint in order to minimise our carbon emissions, so we can stand by our values towards people & planet. we achieve carbon neutrality for our entire value chain through projects that have a positive impact on the planet.

settings.title: measurement-driven sustainability
settings.subtitle: BCOME, our climate partner
settings.desc: every scandale éco-lingerie is accessed of its impact. results are published to the public via the QR code on each garment & on our website. through the data, it drives our future business decisions to further challenge ourselves to be better. the goal is to reduce our CO2eq by unit by -40% to <0.5kg CO2eq upstream

settings.title: biggest achievements this year
settings.short_description:
planet - 100% éco-fabrics & carbon neutral
using 100% certified éco-fabrics, we created our collection preserving planet resources with -55% CO2eq, -50% water, -20% chemicals. with our wind project with ClimatePartner, we achieved carbon neutral

settings.title: carbon neutral
settings.short_description: We use scientific measurements in our every process and to reduce as much as we can our impact. Through our collaboration with ClimatePartner, we offset the remaining 1.8kg CO2e to achieve a net-zero impact to the environment.

settings.title: advanced traceability
settings.short_description: We use scientific measurements in our every process and to reduce as much as we can our impact. Through our collaboration with ClimatePartner, we offset the remaining 1.8kg CO2e to achieve a net-zero impact to the environment.

settings.desc: We use scientific measurements in our every process and to reduce as much as we can our impact. Through our collaboration with ClimatePartner, we offset the remaining 1.8kg CO2e to achieve a net-zero impact to the environment.

settings.title: planet - 100% éco-fabrics & carbon neutral
settings.desc: using 100% certified éco-fabrics, we created our collection preserving planet resources with -55% CO2eq, -50% water, -20% chemicals. with our wind project with ClimatePartner, we achieved carbon neutral

settings.desc: with our éco-fabrics & working hand-in-hand with manufacturers, we select materials with high level of previous life materials in our permanent collection.

settings.description: we want to make ourselves accountable for our impact on planet & people. while we are building our climate goals based on a SBTi approved roadmap, we will continue to refine our goals & share our progress in regular sustainability updates. the goal is to reduce our GHG emissions in our value chain to reach a positive impact to our environment. we invite you to track our progress together.

settings.title: 1. further reducing our carbon footprint
settings.desc: next, we have to increase adoption of renewable energy upstream - in our factories & manufacturing process. for downstream, we will continue to promote a more sustainable way to take care of your éco lingerie: no dryer, no iron & wash by hand

settings.title: 2. tier 3 traceability
settings.desc:
fashion supply chains are often fragmented & complex.
we know 100% of our tier-1 & tier-2 suppliers and continue investigating our tier-3 suppliers so we can stand by our values towards people & planet

settings.title: 3. chemical dyes
settings.desc: would never be our best friends either but they bring colour vibrancy & longevity to products. we continue investigating for more sustainable alternatives

settings.title: 4. closing the loop
settings.desc: because of the complexity of lingerie, as materials are in small pieces & often mixed, giving another life after product-life can be a challenge. we will continue to find solutions & partners to make it a reality

settings.title: people - BSR member
settings.desc: become part of industrial collective effort to scale our impact for a more just & sustainable world

settings.title: planet - carbon neutral from start
settings.desc: by using LCA to understand our carbon footprint and offsetting it, we are carbon neutral

settings.title: transparency - Transparency Pledge
settings.desc: join the force in the fashion industry to demonstrate our commitment towards greater transparency in our manufacturing supply chain

settings.title: a Pending B Corporation
settings.desc: a big believer in the B-Corp movement and are proud to be officially part of the movement

settings.title: traceability - value chain transparency

settings.title: how we met?
settings.content:
one of us at scandale worked at Cerie. she kindly introduced scandale éco-lingerie to Cecilia, the daughter of founder Rita Wong.
we realised that we share the same vision of making sensual lingerie & sustainability to live together, then our partnership started & we are thrilled to innovate together keeping people & planet in mind.

settings.title: a more éco future
settings.content:
besides Cecilia, we work closely with Cerie's compliance manager, Kevin.

focusing on reducing their environmental footprint - began with switching to renewable energy & through various policies from resource efficiency & packaging.

we are actively involved in social projects with Cerie, introducing our first BSR HERproject in Cerie in early 2022 - raising awareness & knowledge on critical health & well-being topics.
Cerie is in the progress of joining the WWF's Low Carbon Manufacturing Program (LCMP) through our introduction.

settings.title: certifications & audits
settings.content:
OCS 100, RCS 100, Standard 100 by OEKO-TEX®, Sedex, Higg Index Facility Environmental Module
factory detail information

settings.desc:
at scandale éco-lingerie, we work with partners who care, educate & empower the people making your lingerie.

all our suppliers are adhere to the scandale code of conduct. They are regularly reviewed on their social & environmental responsibilities, and transparency.

settings.newsletter_form_heading: french touch fashion lingerie with people & planet in mind

settings.title: free delivery
settings.text:
on your first order

use the code BIENVENUE
